bill_title: establish a safety zone around occupied dwellings located adjacent to certain public hunting areas.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a safety zone around occupied dwellings located adjacent to certain public hunting areas. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 41-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person, while hunting or target shooting on any game production area or any other land that is open to public hunting and is managed the Department of Game, Fish and Parks, may discharge a firearm within six hundred sixty feet of any occupied dwelling, whether the dwelling lies inside or outside the public hunting or shooting area. This prohibition applies only if the owner of the dwelling has requested the department to establish such a safety zone and if the department has approved the request. If the department approves a request to establish a safety zone pursuant to this Act, the department shall mark the boundaries of the safety zone that lie within the public hunting area. The Game, Fish and Parks Commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify procedures and forms for applying for a safety zone designation pursuant to this Act and specifications for marking the boundaries of the safety zone. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
